abstract: The second week of earnings opens on Monday for the nation’s banks with at least two – Bank of America and the National City Corporation – looking for ways to raise fresh capital, The New York Times reported Sunday night.
lead_paragraph: The second week of earnings opens on Monday for the nation’s banks with at least two – Bank of America and the National City Corporation – looking for ways to raise fresh capital, The New York Times reported Sunday night.

headline.main: 2 Banks Said to Be Trying to Raise More Capital

abstract: The bank announced nearly $2 billion in write-downs and a 77 percent decline in profits for the first quarter.
snippet: The bank announced nearly $2 billion in write-downs and a 77 percent decline in profits for the first quarter.
lead_paragraph: In another sign of the pain gripping the financial industry, Bank of America said on Monday that its quarterly profit declined 77 percent and that it was bracing for heavy losses on consumer loans.

headline.main: Bank of America Braces for Consumer Loan Loss
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Braces for Losses in Consumer Loans

abstract: Bank of America and National City Corporation are said to be looking for ways to raise fresh capital.
snippet: Bank of America and National City Corporation are said to be looking for ways to raise fresh capital.
lead_paragraph: The second week of earnings opens on Monday for the nation’s banks with at least two  Bank of America and the National City Corporation  looking for ways to raise fresh capital.

headline.main: 2 Banks Said to Be Trying to Raise More Capital
headline.print_headline: 2 Banks Said to Be Trying To Raise More Capital

byline.original: By Eric Dash and Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Sears Holdings said on Friday that a credit agreement with Bank of America would come to an end after the bank would not agree to renew it under existing terms. Shares of Sears fell 3 percent in after-hours trading after it said in a Securities and Exchange Commission filing that the secured credit agreement would end in July.
lead_paragraph: Sears Holdings said on Friday that a credit agreement with Bank of America would come to an end after the bank would not agree to renew it under existing terms. Shares of Sears fell 3 percent in after-hours trading after it said in a Securities and Exchange Commission filing that the secured credit agreement would end in July.

headline.main: Sears Loses Pact With Bank of America

abstract: BNP Paribas is in advanced talks to buy the equities prime brokerage unit of Bank of America in a move that would boost the French group’s presence in the U.S. and enable its U.S. rival to scale down its investment banking business, The Financial Times.
lead_paragraph: BNP Paribas is in advanced talks to buy the equities prime brokerage unit of Bank of America in a move that would boost the French group’s presence in the U.S. and enable its U.S. rival to scale down its investment banking business, The Financial Times.

headline.main: BNP Paribas in Talks for BofA’s Prime Brokerage Unit, Report Says

abstract: Bank of America said Monday that it saw a 77 percent drop in its profits for its first quarter this year from last year, as the banking giant announced nearly $2 billion in write-downs tied to its debt underwriting and trading activities.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America said Monday that it saw a 77 percent drop in its profits for its first quarter this year from last year, as the banking giant announced nearly $2 billion in write-downs tied to its debt underwriting and trading activities.

headline.main: Bank of America Profit Falls on Write-Downs
